sentence: Estee Lauder Companies, Inc. ( EL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on February 24, 2017.
A cash dividend payment of $0.34 per share is scheduled to be paid on March 15, 2017.
Shareholders who purchased EL prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This represents an 13.33% increase over prior dividend payment.
The previous trading day's last sale of EL was $84.2, representing a -13.62% decrease from the 52 week high of $97.48 and a 11.83% increase over the 52 week low of $75.30.
EL is a part of the Consumer Non-Durables sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever PLC ( UL ).
EL's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $2.9.
Zacks Investment Research reports EL's forecasted earnings growth in 2017 as 3.7%, compared to an industry average of 5.9%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the EL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
